result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shaila K Bart

records.addlTxt: Hearing on December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:37 AM; Case called for Hearing. Defendant Shaila K Bart in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Shaila K Bart.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Kershek provides an update; his client is currently undergoing counseling and will be beginning parenting classes.  Atty. Kershek requests another further proceedings date in about 45 days.  No objection by the State, and they will put a note in the file to the ADA assigned to begin negotiations with respect to an offer with defense counsel.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
10:40 AM Defendant Shaila K Bart appeared by video.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Shaila K Bart.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Kershek states he does not have a conflict.
The Court appoints attorney Kershek as counsel. 
Preliminary time limits waived. 
Attorney Kershek requests a status of prelim.
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT IN PERSON.
Hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Hearing on September 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on September 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.

2:15 PM Defendant Shaila K Bart appeared by zoom video. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.  Attorney Mark Kershek appearing in person.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 
Defendant needs more time to obtain counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing. Defendant can appear by zoom for the next hearing.  Atty. Kershek will be appoint as counsel for this case.  Atty. Kershek  will in form the court if he has a conflict with this case.
Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Hearing on August 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to comply with all the terms in Walworth County Case No. 22CV386.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.
Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing August 15, 2022. (BC)

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 09:26 AM Defendant Shaila K Bart in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing August 15, 2022.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  The defendant is allowed to appear by Zoom at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
